chargeHist.descr: Possession of Hydrocodone, second or subsequent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene A. REZACHEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

Minutes.
RE:  Possession of Narcotic Drugs, second and subsequent, on or about 10-14-2015

ADDRESS INFO for Gene A. Rezachek
Current: 1402 South 37th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 10-15-2015)
Prior: 1506 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule I or II narcotic, resist officer, and theft.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-02-2015, at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he must provide and address to the Clerk of Cour Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release, have no contact with the residence located at 1506 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI, must maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
